intro: Strateuma, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. Strateuma species are often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
